eligibilityCriteria.criteria: Films completed within 12 months before the start of the festival, minimum 60 minutes long, and preferably world premieres.
Films up to 30 minutes long, completed within the last 12 months, and preferably world premieres.
Films up to 20 minutes long, completed within the last 12 months.
Films promoting cinematographic heritage, newly restored copies, or documentaries about cinema.

fees.feeDetails: €175 for feature-length films, regardless of the number of sections you apply for.

festivalInfo.description: The Berlin International Film Festival (Berlinale) is one of the world's most prestigious film festivals, showcasing international films from big-budget productions to indie gems. It also hosts events that foster creativity and innovation in the global film community.
festivalInfo.name: Berlin International Film Festival (Berlinale)

featureFilm.conditions: Films completed within the 12 months prior to the festival and a minimum of 60 minutes in duration. World premieres are preferred, but European premieres are accepted for some sections.

shortFilm.conditions: Films up to 30 minutes long, completed in the last 12 months. World premieres are preferred.

generationShortFilm.conditions: Films under 20 minutes, completed in the last 12 months, preferably world premieres.

quoraExperience.content: Berlinale was a phenomenal experience with amazing premieres, top directors, and a cinephile atmosphere. Highly recommend it!
